ppe_requirements.respiratory: NIOSH-approved air-purifying respirator with P100 particulate filters for <0.2 mg/m³. SCBA for unknown concentrations or emergency response.
ppe_requirements.skin: Nitrile or butyl rubber gloves, chemical-resistant clothing. PAHs absorb through skin - double gloving recommended for prolonged exposure.
ppe_requirements.eye: Chemical safety goggles, face shield for dusty operations
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level C for known concentrations <0.2 mg/m³, Level B for unknown or >0.2 mg/m³
ppe_requirements.special_notes: PAH is carcinogenic - minimize skin contact. Decontaminate immediately after exposure. Disposable protective clothing recommended for heavy contamination.

physical_properties.appearance: Pale yellow to tan crystalline solid, needles or plates

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Combustible solid. May burn in sustained fire. Produces carcinogenic PAH compounds in smoke.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Dry chemical, CO2, water spray, foam. Wear SCBA - toxic combustion products. Contain runoff.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: Avoid generating dust. Sweep/vacuum with HEPA filter. Place in sealed containers. DO NOT wash down drains - PAH contamination persists. Dispose as hazardous waste.
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove contaminated clothing immediately. Wash skin thoroughly with soap and water. Do not use solvents on skin. If inhaled, move to fresh air. Seek medical attention - inform physician of carcinogen exposure.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Very toxic to aquatic life. Persists in environment (soil/sediment for years). Bioaccumulates in food chain. Report spills >1 lb.
emergency_response.special_hazards: KNOWN HUMAN CARCINOGEN (IARC Group 1). Causes lung cancer, skin cancer, leukemia. Mutagenic and teratogenic. PAH exposure linked to multiple cancers. Contaminated soil requires remediation.

storage_requirements.temperature_range: Store at room temperature, avoid excessive heat >30°C
storage_requirements.ventilation: Local exhaust ventilation to control dust. Store in well-ventilated area.
storage_requirements.container_material: Tightly sealed glass or plastic containers. Store away from light.
storage_requirements.segregation: Separate from oxidizers and incompatibles. Designated carcinogen storage area.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: Minimize quantities. Follow institutional carcinogen storage protocols.
storage_requirements.special_requirements: Post "CANCER HAZARD" signs. Restrict access to authorized trained personnel only. Secondary containment required. Inspect containers regularly for integrity.

reactivity.stability: Stable under normal conditions. Light-sensitive. Decomposes at high temperatures.
reactivity.reactivity_hazard: May react with strong oxidizers. Generally stable but avoid high heat.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Very toxic to aquatic organisms. LC50 (fathead minnow, 96h): 3.7 µg/L. Bioaccumulates in fish - BCF 1,100-15,000.
environmental_impact.biodegradability: Poorly biodegradable. Degradation half-life in soil: months to years. Resistant to microbial breakdown.
environmental_impact.bioaccumulation: High bioaccumulation potential. Log Kow: 6.04-6.50. Accumulates in fatty tissues and sediments.
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: Low mobility. Strongly adsorbs to soil/sediment organic matter. Persistent in contaminated sites.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Primarily bound to particulate matter. Photolyzes slowly under UV light. Atmospheric half-life: hours to days on particles.

reportable_releases.water: 1 lb to navigable waters - reportable to NRC

detection_monitoring.odor_threshold: Not applicable - no characteristic warning odor at hazardous levels
